channel.title: Trying to save an old DVD
channel.description:
I have an old Blues Clues dvd that is scratched pretty bad and has issues when I try to play it. I want to try to save and reburn it to a new dvd so that my 5 year old can continue to enjoy it, but I am unsure of what I am doing. I need an expert please?
Here are the programs I have:
DVD Shrink 3.2 Magic ISO DVD Decripter
Right now it appears the DVD Shrink 3.2 is saving it or backing it up to disk. Does anyone know the next steps I would do? Obviously I know to put a DVD disc[b] in[/b] the DVD Burner, but from there I am unsure of what program I should use or if I have the wrong ones and need something different. Yes I am a noob at this so please save the laughter.
kthnx!

item.title: Trying to save an old DVD
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
I am working on child number two loving some of these. First it was nathan that loved Telli Tubbies, then Barney and Blues Clues. Now it is Isaac that got into the same three. He is now graduating into Mickey Mouse Clubhouse which is less annoying for me.

Yeah, but I need to still save some of these old ones cuz they ARE 2 hours worth of entertainment.

Read full topic
item.source: Trying to save an old DVD

item.title: Trying to save an old DVD
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I also prefer the originals, even though I never see them, I just hear from the other room where my little sister is watching them on VHS

BLUES CLUES BLUES CLUES YOU KNOW WHAT TO DO SIT DOWN IN THE THINKING CHAIR THINK THINK THINK

If you think it’s annoying hearing that every day, imagine also hearing them all dubbed in french, and russian… Even though russian cartoons of this genre are just as annoying.

Read full topic

item.source: Trying to save an old DVD

item.title: Trying to save an old DVD
item.dc:creator: joker
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

Am I just doing a copy paste onto the dvd then or do I need a program to do it?

Again, sorry for my newb questions.

IT’s simple, you use magiciso, you create a .iso of your disc.Then, you take a blank dvd and you burn the .iso on the dvd. The end xD

Read full topic

well, okay

Damn that man. This sweater is stupid.

item.title: Trying to save an old DVD
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
Kid shows on DVD are cheap as dirt, I’d just toss it and buy the box set.

Also, the only good episodes of Blues Clues are the original '90s ones with Steve. Whoever says otherwise is a troll.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to save an old DVD
item.dc:creator: joker
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

I now have a directory with bup, ifo, and vob files for my blues clues. Am I right to understand it is the Magic ISO program that will put all these files back together again on a DVD? (I would try it rather than ask, however I dont have the DVD’s yet. I just wanna make sure I understand what I WILL be doing once I have the dvds)

IF you have bup, ifo and vob, when you will put it on a new dvd, it will “change” them in the real files.

Read full topic

item.description:

Download and burn to DVD. Easiest method. You already have the DVD so it’s not illegal.

WINNER!

except blues clues episodes are quite hard to find in decent quality, and some kids enjoy the dvd menus which are not included in warez releases.

item.title: Trying to save an old DVD
item.dc:creator: _amp_955_dam
item.description:
Hmm, what I normally use to grab a movie off of it’s original disk is by using either a Converter program or something like PowerISO (MagicISO will work as well).

I use Total Video Converter, so I don’t know how to show that method to you.

Normally I would expect that it can be done easily through Magic ISO itself.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to save an old DVD
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
I have an old Blues Clues dvd that is scratched pretty bad and has issues when I try to play it. I want to try to save and reburn it to a new dvd so that my 5 year old can continue to enjoy it, but I am unsure of what I am doing. I need an expert please?

Here are the programs I have:

DVD Shrink 3.2
Magic ISO
DVD Decripter

Right now it appears the DVD Shrink 3.2 is saving it or backing it up to disk. Does anyone know the next steps I would do? Obviously I know to put a DVD disc in the DVD Burner, but from there I am unsure of what program I should use or if I have the wrong ones and need something different. Yes I am a noob at this so please save the laughter.

kthnx!
